title: 103_s879
content: The Act is titled the "Work Force Enhancement for Technology Transfer Act" and its purpose is outlined in Section 2 as a finding and purpose. Congress finds that skilled American workers are crucial for the nation's productivity and competitiveness, especially in utilizing advanced technologies in manufacturing. Investing in technology and targeted worker training can enhance productivity and competitiveness for US manufacturing firms. United States manufacturing firms, especially smaller ones, are increasingly seeking technical and managerial assistance from the Department of Commerce's National Institute of Standards and Technology to identify and implement advanced technologies. The Institute can provide training and promote the development of effective training materials for the operation of these technologies. The Act aims to enhance the international competitiveness, standard of living, and national security of the United States by expanding technology extension activities to include worker training in advanced technologies. It promotes the development of training materials and serves as a clearinghouse for information on the best available training materials. The Worker Training Act focuses on expanding technology extension activities to include worker training in advanced technologies. It promotes the development of training materials and serves as a clearinghouse for information on the best available training materials. The Secretary of Commerce directs Regional Centers for the Transfer of Manufacturing Technology to assist US manufacturing firms in utilizing advanced technologies by assessing training needs and providing support. The Regional Centers for the Transfer of Manufacturing Technology assist US manufacturing firms by providing information on worker training services for the effective utilization of specific technologies adopted or planned to be adopted. They also offer accessible and affordable training services when such training is not available from other sources. SEC. 4. WORKER TRAINING ANALYSIS AND INFORMATION DISSEMINATION. The Secretary, through the Director, will assist United States manufacturing firms in utilizing advanced technologies by managing a clearinghouse for information on training materials and services. The Secretary will assist manufacturing firms in utilizing advanced technologies by encouraging the development of training material specifically designed for managers and workers responsible for operating such technologies. This includes establishing the availability of training material as an important criterion in the assessment of advanced technologies. Authorization of appropriations for the technology training clearinghouse: $2,000,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $3,000,000 for each of fiscal years 1995 and 1996.
